Updated November     pm



cft

The IUP Artistry Movement I.A.M. is back in action this fall PERIOD

I.A.M PERIOD was born two years ago courtesy of Tieshay Skinner the original president and Sharese Robinson the original vice president PERIOD The two students started the club in hopes to create a positive outlet where students could express their work to the public PERIOD I.A.M.s first public event was titled Black Lives Matter and was featured in two local papers PERIOD

The club is under new management now as students have since graduated PERIOD I.A.M.s current president is Julian Lee senior communications media PERIOD Lee was the organizations first official member PERIOD Lee encourages creative writers actors singers and dancers to join PERIOD

This year we will bring different art forms together on one unified harmonized platform Lee said PERIOD

Lee is referring to different genres of writing dancing and singing meshing together into one platform PERIOD I.A.M.s last performance included jazz vocals and instruments that incorporated acting PERIOD The club can be beneficial to students who are insecure with their work PERIOD

We want to work with writers to null the sense of state fright Lee said PERIOD

Since joining members like Rashon Early senior hospitality management have experienced improvements personally and academically PERIOD Early started as a member and has since become the treasurer and the event coordinator PERIOD

I have better public speaking skills and I learned how to build personal relationships with people Ive never met Early said PERIOD

Students excited to see I.A.M PERIOD in action are invited to their first open mic night at  p.m PERIOD Thursday at The Artists Hand on Philadelphia Street PERIOD

Students interested in performing creative writing and personal expression are encouraged to join PERIOD There will be an I.A.M PERIOD table set at for IUP Day in the Kovalchick Convention and Athletic Complex Friday PERIOD The first official meeting will be held at  p.m PERIOD Tuesday on the first floor of Ackerman Hall PERIOD

To learn more contact the clubs adviser Dr PERIOD Daniel J PERIOD Puhlman or visit him in  Ackerman Hall PERIOD
